basics.name: Sergio Fabregat
basics.label: Graphics Programmer
basics.summary: I am a curious, motivated and active person. I'm always busy building or exploring something new, approaching every project with dedication and a determination to do it the best way I know. I love to delve in and learn about the subjects that spark my attention, such as videogames, science, horror, bodybuilding and, mainly, computer graphics. I am passionate about teaching and sharing back the things I've learned. I aspire to be a person others turn to for expertise. I strive to keep learning and growing through challenging and interesting new projects, while helping those around me do the same.

work.name: AUTIS Ingenieros
work.summary: Worked on rendering photorealistic images of car bodies under the specific conditions of inspection tunnels.
highlights: Implemented an irradiance cache for diffuse lighting.
Implemented Monte Carlo ray tracing for specular reflections.
Implemented a bilateral denoiser to clean up the ray tracer.
Built an interface over Radeon ProRender to adapt it to our specific rendering requirements.

projects.name: Quarantamaula Engine
projects.summary: Custom OpenGL engine developed to teach myself computer graphics.

projects.name: Genetic Invaders
projects.summary: Mobile arcade game based in Unity made to teach the player key concepts of genetics.

projects.name: Go Back to Dead
projects.summary: Infuriated that a zombie apocalypse has reanimated millions of people and ruined all his hard work, Death itself, controlled by the player, must slay as many zombies as he can in this top-down arcade game
highlights: Made for a university game jam.
Developed in Unity by a team of 5.
My contributions were leading the team, game design and programming.

projects.name: The Cat
projects.summary: In this turn-based game the player takes the role of a cat-sitter. They must rearrange furniture to protect their friend’s precious items from his unpredictable pet.
highlights: Made for the GMTK 2020 game jam, which had the theme 'Out of Control'.
Developed in Unity by a team of 3.
My contributions were game design and programming.
